attributes.action: Charge PSCs and Mercenaries for Crimes against humanity
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The increasing and widespread use of Private Security Contractors (PSCs), especially since UK, US and other Armed Forces personnel are present in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Paul Bremer provided immunity from prosecution to Contractors from Iraqi Jurisdiction one day before the dissolution of the Coalition Provisional Authority (CPA), an extension to Order 17, granting personnel and contractors immunity from prosecution by the Iraq Government making it impossible for future Iraqi governments to prosecute PSCs. 
 
This is important due to the fact that most of the PSCs have been involved in unauthorised incidents that includes the illegal killing of innocent Iraqis and Afghan Nationals, destruction of properties, untrained personnel employed to carry and use of lethal weapons.

While UK and US Forces are providing security, the use of PSCs is illegal and a clear violation of International Laws.
